name: Uganda
introduction: The colonial boundaries created by Britain to delimit Uganda grouped together a wide range of ethnic groups with different political systems and cultures. These differences complicated the establishment of a working political community after independence was achieved in 1962. The dictatorial regime of Idi AMIN (1971-79) was responsible for the deaths of some 300000 opponents; guerrilla war and human rights abuses under Milton OBOTE (1980-85) claimed at least another 100000 lives. The rule of Yoweri MUSEVENI since 1986 has brought relative stability and economic growth to Uganda. A constitutional referendum in 2005 cancelled a 19-year ban on multi-party politics and lifted presidential term limits.
overview: Uganda is a landlocked country in East Africa whose diverse landscape encompasses the snow-capped Rwenzori Mountains and immense Lake Victoria. Its abundant wildlife includes chimpanzees as well as rare birds. Remote Bwindi Impenetrable National Park is a renowned mountain gorilla sanctuary. Murchison Falls National Park in the northwest is known for its 43m-tall waterfall and wildlife such as hippos.

languages.name: Acoli
languages.area: North, Kitgum District; Adjumani and Pader districts. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Adhola
languages.area: East, Tororo District (Uganda Districts Information Handbook).

languages.name: Alur
languages.area: Orientale Province, Mahagi Territory, northwest to Djalasiga area. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: Bari
languages.area: South, both banks of the Nile, south of Terakeka on west bank, south of Mongalla on east bank, as far as Kajo Kaji Escarpment. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: Bera
languages.area: Orientale Province, Ituri District, Irumu Territory.

languages.name: Bukusu
languages.area: Western Province, Bungoma District, Mt. Elgon.

languages.name: Chiga
languages.area: Extreme southwest: Kanungu, Kabale, Kisoro, Ntungamo, and Rukungiri districts.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Goan Konkani
languages.area: South coast strip of Maharashtra, Ratnagari District; Goa; Karnataka; Kerala. Also in Kenya, United Arab Emirates.

languages.name: Gujarati
languages.area: Gujarat; Maharashtra; Rajasthan; Karnataka; Madhya Pradesh. Also in Bangladesh, Botswana, Canada, Fiji, Kenya, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Oman, Pakistan, Réunion, Singapore, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda, United Kingdom, United States, Zambia, Zimbabwe.

languages.name: Gwere
languages.area: Pallisa District, dominating 2 of the district’s 4 counties.

languages.name: Haya
languages.area: Kagera region, mainly Bukoba Urban and Bukoba Rural districts.

languages.name: Hindi
languages.area: Throughout north India: Delhi; Uttar Pradesh; Uttarakhand; Rajasthan; Punjab; Madhya Pradesh; northern Bihar; Himachal Pradesh. Also in Bangladesh, Belize, Bhutan, Botswana, Canada, Djibouti, Germany, Kenya, Nepal, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Yemen, Zambia.

languages.name: Ik
languages.area: Northeast Karamoja.

languages.name: Kamba (Kenya)
languages.area: South central, Eastern Province, Machakos and Kitui districts; Coast Province, Kwale District.

languages.name: Keliko
languages.area: South, south Yei District. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Uganda.

languages.name: Kumam
languages.area: West Teso District, south of Lake Kwania.

languages.name: Karamojong
languages.area: East and northeast, Karamojo District, Moroto area.

languages.name: Kakwa
languages.area: Northwest corner, West Nile District. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Sudan.

languages.name: Kikuyu
languages.area: West central, Central Province, Kiambu, Murang’a, Nyeri, and Kirinyaga districts.

languages.name: Kinyarwanda
languages.area: Also in Burundi, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Uganda.

languages.name: Koongo
languages.area: Bas-Congo Province cataract, Mbanza Manteke area; Fioti north of Boma, and scattered along Congo River from Brazzaville to its mouth. Also in Angola, Congo.

languages.name: Konzo
languages.area: Southwest, Ruwenzori Mountains. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Kupsabiny
languages.area: East, Kapchorwa District, Kenya border.

languages.name: Lango (Uganda)
languages.area: Central, Apac and Lira districts, north of Lake Kyoga.

languages.name: Lendu
languages.area: Orientale Province, Ituri District, Djugu Territory, west and northwest of Lake Albert. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: Lugbara
languages.area: Northwest, Arua and Yumbe districts. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Lingala
languages.area: Widespread in Bandundu, Equateur, and Orientale provinces, southeast Orientale. Also in Central African Republic, Congo.

languages.name: Kenyi
languages.area: Busoga Province between Lake Victoria and Lake Kyoga.

languages.name: Saamia
languages.area: East, Busia District, Kenya border, Lake Victoria is south border. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Aringa
languages.area: Northwest corner, north of Lake Albert, Yumbe District, Aringa County, north of Lugbara, west of Ma’di.

languages.name: Ganda
languages.area: Southeast, primarily Buganda Province, Lake Victoria northwest shore to Lake Kyoga and Tanzania border.

languages.name: Olu'bo
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, 50 km east of Nile River. Main town is Lokiliri, between Juba-Torit and Juba-Nimule roads.

languages.name: Mangbetu
languages.area: Orientale Province, Rungu, Niangara, Poko, Watsa, Wamba, and northeast corner of Banalia territories. Popoi in Banalia Territory; Aberu in Wamba Territory.

languages.name: Ma'di
languages.area: North, Moyo and Adjumani districts, West Nile District near Nimule, north Sudan border. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Mvuba
languages.area: Nord-Kivu Province, Beni Territory, Oicha area. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: Masaaba
languages.area: East, Mbale and Sirinko districts, adjacent to Mount Elgon.

languages.name: Ndo
languages.area: Northwest. Mahigi is center. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Nande
languages.area: Nord-Kivu Province, mainly Beni and Lubero territories.

languages.name: Nyole
languages.area: Southeast, Tororo District.

languages.name: Nyankole
languages.area: Southwest, Bushenyi and Mbarara districts mainly; Kanungu, Ntungamo, and Rukungiri districts.

languages.name: Nyoro
languages.area: West, Hoima, Masindi, Bundibugyo, Kamwenge, and Kibale districts, south and southeast of Lake Albert.

languages.name: Nyang'i
languages.area: East, Kotido District, Dodoth County, Karenga Subcounty along Nyangea Mountians’ west side.

languages.name: Pökoot
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Baringo and West Pokot districts. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: Gungu
languages.area: Hoima and Masindi districts, Buliisa, Bilso, and Kigorobya subcounties, Rift Valley, Lake Albert northeast shore; hills above the valley.

languages.name: Ruuli
languages.area: Central, Nakasongola (mainly), Masindi, Luwero, and Kayunga districts, west of the Nile, Lake Kyoga area.

languages.name: Rundi
languages.area: Also in Rwanda, Tanzania, Uganda.

languages.name: Amba (Uganda)
languages.area: Democratic Republic of the Congo border area south of Lake Albert, Beni District, Watalinga and Bawisa subcounties; Ruwenzori Mountains, Bundibugyo District. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Singa
languages.area: Rusinga Island.

languages.name: Southern Ma'di
languages.area: Arua District, Madi-Okollo County, Nile River west bank.

languages.name: Spanish
languages.area: Central, south; Canary Islands. Also in Andorra, Anguilla, Argentina, Aruba, Australia, Belgium, Belize, Bolivia, Canada, Cayman Islands, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Finland, France, Germany, Gibraltar, Guatemala, Honduras, Israel, Jamaica, Mexico, Morocco, Netherlands Antilles, Nicaragua, Norway, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Sweden, Switzerland, Trinidad and Tobago, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Uruguay, Venezuela.

languages.name: Swahili (Coastal)
languages.area: Zanzibar, coastal areas. Also in Burundi, Canada, Kenya, Libya, Mayotte, Mozambique, Oman, Rwanda, Somalia, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United States.

languages.name: Teso
languages.area: East, Katakwi (mainly), Soroti, Kaberamaido, Kumi, Pallisa, and Tororo districts. Lokathan, Madial area, Nangeya Mountains north end. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Soo
languages.area: East, Moroto District, Moroto, Napak, and Kadam mountains border.

languages.name: Talinga-Bwisi
languages.area: Democratic Republic of the Congo border, Bwamba County, Bundibugyo District, southwest of Fort Portal, between Albert and Edward lakes, near Kilembe. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Toposa
languages.area: South, Singaita and Lokalyen rivers’ sides. Ritual center at Loyooro River. Migrate to Moruangipi, and farther east for seasonal grazing into Ilemi Triangle at Ethiopia border, but no permanent settlements there.

languages.name: Tooro
languages.area: West, south and southeast of Lake Albert; Kabarole, Kibale, Bundibugyo, Kamwenge, Kyenjojo and Kasese districts.

languages.name: Ugandan Sign Language
languages.area: Widespread, mainly in towns.

languages.name: Soga
languages.area: Central, between lakes Victoria and Kyoga: Kamuli, Bagiri and Mayuge districts; Kaliro District (Lulamogi Dialect); Jinja District (Lutenga Dialect); Iganga District, Busiki County (Lusiki Dialect).
